results.title: An Island nation: Japan
results.creator_credit: Victor Jurgens and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
Life in urban and rural Japan, showing the customs and work of a Japanese farm family as observed by their young cousin from the city. Shows how this country of 80,000,000 people, handicapped by mountainous terrain and without the necessary raw materials for industrial development, has done to overcome her difficulties. Japan’s industry is based on the importation of raw materials and the selling of finished products throughout the world, made possible by low wages and long hours of work. In rural areas, people work long and hard to gain a livelihood from the soil.

results.title: An Irish Medley 423
results.brief_description: Englishman Reginald Foot plays and sings ten Irish national melodies such as Londonderry Air, Killarney and St Patrick’s Day which are paired with scenes of rural Ireland.

results.title: An Invitation to Japan
results.brief_description: Shows the tourist attractions found along Japan’s most representative travel route: Tokyo, Nikko, Kamakura, Hakone, Kyoto, Nara, Osaka, highlighting such places as the Great Buddha at Kamakura, the Olympic Games site and the Toshogu Shrine at Nikko. Also shows typical Japanese food, pearls, kimonos, porcelain and textiles.

results.title: An Introduction to visual illusions (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Stanley Halls, Caldwell-Halls Productions and John Caldwell
results.brief_description: Professor Joseph Lyons explains the functions of the eye and the brain in perception, how the brain collates information about distance, perspective and movement. A variety of ingenious film techniques are used to illustrate visual illusions.

results.title: An Introduction to vectors: coplanar concurrent forces
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: Explains the meaning of scalar and vector quantities; how to add scalars and vectors; methods of vector composition and vector resolution; relationship between vector composition and vector resolution; and how vectors may be used to solve engineering problems.

results.title: An Introduction to the lathe
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lathework series”.
Various operations are shown briefly, then a simple type of lathe is examined systematically, headstock, cradle, tailstock, methods of holding the work by chucks, by face plate and between centres. Methods of feed, hand and automatic.

results.title: An Introduction to the defence cataloguing system
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Yoram Gross Films, Film Australia and Yoram Gross
results.brief_description: Modern warfare involving greater man power and more complex weaponry creates greater problems of supply. Efficient supply management is essential. A common supply language has been devised enabling items to be easily found.

results.title: An Introduction to the art of figure skating
results.brief_description: The fundamentals of figure skating are demonstrated by world champion Barbara Ann Scott and coach and judge Melville Rogers. A brief discussion of edges and basic figures is followed by an analysis of a number of complex turns. The importance of balance, body, and limbs is explained.
